-809642033.subject: ü•á Apple‚Äôs Epic ‚Äúvictory‚Äù
-809642033.text:
‚Ä¶ and Netflix‚Äôs K-pop moment means we could get another ‚ÄúSquid Game‚Äù
 

Tim cooked up a legal victory (Jerod Harris/Getty Images)

 
Yesterday‚Äôs Market Moves
 
Dow Jones
33,531 (-1.02%)		S&P 500
4,072 (-1.58%)		Nasdaq
11,799 (-1.98%)		Bitcoin
$28,291 (+2.80%)
Dow Jones
33,531 (-1.02%)		S&P 500
4,072 (-1.58%)
Nasdaq
11,799 (-1.98%)		Bitcoin
$28,291 (+2.80%)

Hey Snackers,

Artificial intelligence is buzzy, but some bots are getting bashed: Snap released a ChatGPT-powered bot called ‚ÄúMy AI‚Äù ‚Äî and pinned it to the top of everyone‚Äôs feed with no option of removing it. Since then, Snap‚Äôs App Store page has been flooded with 1-star reviews (the top keyword: ‚ÄúAI‚Äù).

The Nasdaq sank 2% yesterday ahead of Big Tech earnings (part one), which came in after the bell. Microsoft and Alphabet shares spiked after they reported expectation-topping numbers. Meta's up next today, followed by Amazon tomorrow.

Skins

Apple declares victory in its App Store battle versus Fortnite, but there‚Äôs a banana peel in its path

Victory Royale‚Ä¶ Apple described its day in court versus Epic Games yesterday as ‚Äúa resounding victory‚Äù after 9 out of 10 of the Fortnite maker‚Äôs claims were decided in Apple‚Äôs favor. Refresher: in 2020, Fortnite was booted from Apple‚Äôs and Google‚Äôs stores after it directed players to its own discounted payment system to bypass the ‚Äúapp tax.‚Äù Epic retaliated by suing both tech titans and making a dramatic ‚Äú1984‚Äù parody video. The legal saga appears to be over:

  • Not a mobile-opoly: Judges ruled that App Store policies don‚Äôt break federal antitrust laws. Apple won‚Äôt need to allow third-party app stores on iOS devices or change its fees.

The one claim that got away‚Ä¶ is the core of Epic‚Äôs suit. The ruling says Apple can‚Äôt bar developers from steering users to off-app purchasing pages to skirt the 15 to 30% fee that Apple skims off in-app purchases (picture: Beef Boss skins). Read: Epic could allow players to set down their shockwave hammers and leave the Fortnite app to pay outside Apple‚Äôs ecosystem. Fortnite hasn‚Äôt been on the App Store since 2020, but it could return this year.

  • Giving up a slice: Last year, Apple started allowing ‚Äúreading apps‚Äù ‚Äî including Netflix, Audible, and Spotify ‚Äî to steer customers to alt payment options. Now it‚Äôll have to extend the policy to games, too, if it fails to appeal this week‚Äôs ruling.

  • Prob-llama: As of 2021, gaming apps made up about 70% of all App Store revenue. If game developers start linking out to other payment options, Apple‚Äôs lucrative biz could take a hit.

THE TAKEAWAY

The walled garden could show cracks‚Ä¶ Apple (mostly) won this round, but scrutiny of its app-store dominance isn‚Äôt over. Authorities in South Korea, the Netherlands, and Japan forced Apple to allow third-party payment systems to be added to apps, and an EU law could mean iOS 17 will open the door to app downloads from third-party app stores (aka: ‚Äúsideloading‚Äù).

K-wave

Netflix is splurging $2.5B on South Korean content as a K-wave goes global

From K-pop to K-drama‚Ä¶ Yesterday Netflix said it plans to spend $2.5B over the next four years to produce South Korean shows and movies, doubling its investment in the market. Over half of Netflix viewers watched Korean content last year, and 40% of its most-watched non-English-language shows are Korean, from revenge drama ‚ÄúThe Glory‚Äù to reality hits like ‚ÄúSingle‚Äôs Inferno.‚Äù As Netflix rolls out its largest-ever lineup of K-content, Disney, Amazon, and Apple are investing in the streaming K-wave. With good reason:

  • Untapped potential: Last quarter, Netflix added 1.5M paid subscribers in Asia Pacific, making it the fastest-growing region by far.

  • Red-jumpsuit mania: ‚ÄúSquid Game‚Äù was a phenomenon, earning a half dozen Emmys and becoming Netflix‚Äôs most watched show or film ever ‚Äî topping 110M viewers.

  • Ram-Don gold: Korean dark comedy ‚ÄúParasite‚Äù made Oscars history in 2020 as the first foreign-language film to win Best Picture.

From ‚ÄúBeef‚Äù to Black Pink‚Ä¶ Korea has become a pop-culture powerhouse and entertainment leader. Just a few examples: K-pop band BTS added $5B/year to the Korean economy (nearly 0.5% of the country's GDP) as the mega-stars took over charts worldwide. This month, the group Black Pink made history as the first Asian band to headline Coachella.

THE TAKEAWAY

One wave can reach many shores‚Ä¶ South Korea‚Äôs entertainment industry isn‚Äôt only boosting the Korean economy; it‚Äôs also fueling international engagement for streamers as its popularity spreads everywhere. While Hollywood has long been the main purveyor of entertainment, Korea‚Äôs solidified its place as an industry leader.

What else we're Snackin'

  • YouToo: Alphabet stock popped after the Google parent beat expectations and announced a $70B share buyback, though growth is sluggish. Ad revenue fell from last year as spending on YouTube commercials sagged.

  • Soft: Microsoft topped profit and sales estimates, despite a continuing slowdown in cloud as companies pulled back on investments. The software heavyweight‚Äôs‚Äôs sales grew just 7% after years of double-digit gains.

  • Based: Coinbase played an UNO reverse card against the SEC, suing the regulator before it could file its own suit. The US‚Äôs largest crypto exchange is trying to force the SEC to issue clearer digital-asset rules.

  • McDeal: McDonald‚Äôs beat quarterly expectations (think: ordering a 6-piece but getting a 10-piece) as inflation-wary US customers continued to hit the drive-thru for meal deals despite price hikes.

  • Wrapped: Spotify hit a record 515M users last quarter, up 22% from a year ago, but swung to a loss as ad revenue disappointed. The streamer plans to share some of its exclusive podcasts to bump their moneymaking potential.

üç™ Thanks for Snacking with us! Want to share the Snacks? Invite your friends to sign up here.

Snack Fact Of the Day
Amazon, Alphabet, Microsoft, and Meta make up about 15% of the S&P 500‚Äôs market value
Read more

Wednesday
  • Earnings expected from Meta, Boeing, Hilton, Norfolk Southern, Roku, Wyndham, and Spirit Airlines

accelerator, and VC. We help the top CS students become tomorrow's tech

backed Airbnb, Dropbox, Facebook, & Uber. He co-founded Code.org
<http://code.org/> (Hour of Code) to bring CS to classrooms. Ali grew up in
Tehran during the Iran-Iraq war, attended Harvard, and sold his first
startup, LinkExchange, in 1998. He's passionate about sustainable food and
loves climbing, snowboarding, guitar, puzzles, & family.*

									SWE‚Äôs Advance Learning Center Newsletter

Welcome to SWE‚Äôs Advance Learning Center Newsletter! Lifelong learning is key to growth in our professional and personal lives. Explore the Advance Learning Center

http://marketing.swe.org/e/858553/2023-04-26/4w7c1n/460008196?h=vgm7abF1EsipmE0_ZWw2MMGrYK2Wc8VC_AU7dfA86nQ

 today for free member professional development opportunities.

									Congratulations to our first Advance Power User!

http://marketing.swe.org/e/858553/3-04-march-advance-power-user-/4w7c1r/460008196?h=vgm7abF1EsipmE0_ZWw2MMGrYK2Wc8VC_AU7dfA86nQ

									SWE is excited to announce Danielle Schroeder, PE (she/her/hers) as this quarter‚Äôs Advance Power User! Want to be the next Advance Power User and get a free WE23

http://marketing.swe.org/e/858553/2023-04-26/4w7c1v/460008196?h=vgm7abF1EsipmE0_ZWw2MMGrYK2Wc8VC_AU7dfA86nQ

 registration grant? Complete as many courses in the Advance Learning Center by June 31st to win. Refer to the rules and regulations on swe.org/learning

http://marketing.swe.org/e/858553/learning/4w7c1y/460008196?h=vgm7abF1EsipmE0_ZWw2MMGrYK2Wc8VC_AU7dfA86nQ

.

									 

												Learn More About Danielle Schroeder ¬ª

http://marketing.swe.org/e/858553/3-04-march-advance-power-user-/4w7c1r/460008196?h=vgm7abF1EsipmE0_ZWw2MMGrYK2Wc8VC_AU7dfA86nQ

									Upcoming Live Web Events

http://marketing.swe.org/e/858553/courses-51673-webinars-34997/4w7c22/460008196?h=vgm7abF1EsipmE0_ZWw2MMGrYK2Wc8VC_AU7dfA86nQ

									Join Stephanie McCullough, founder of Sofia Financial and co-host of the award-winning Take Back Retirement podcast for this presentation where you will learn financial principles, key questions for consideration, and guidance on key early-career decisions including saving, investing, and navigating employee benefits. This project is based upon work partially supported by the generosity of Keysight Technologies. Registration for this live web event is free for all SWE members upon login

http://marketing.swe.org/e/858553/courses-51673-webinars-34997/4w7c22/460008196?h=vgm7abF1EsipmE0_ZWw2MMGrYK2Wc8VC_AU7dfA86nQ

. 

http://marketing.swe.org/e/858553/courses-51672-webinars-34889/4w7c25/460008196?h=vgm7abF1EsipmE0_ZWw2MMGrYK2Wc8VC_AU7dfA86nQ

									Modern neuroscience provides practical insight into how to learn mental skills and knowledge more rapidly. New York Times best-selling author Barbara Oakley, PhD, PE, shares some of these neuroscientific insights, which are extremely useful in today's fast-changing environment where the ability of engineers to reskill and upskill is in high demand. Registration for this live web event is free for all SWE members upon login

http://marketing.swe.org/e/858553/courses-51672-webinars-34889/4w7c25/460008196?h=vgm7abF1EsipmE0_ZWw2MMGrYK2Wc8VC_AU7dfA86nQ

. 

									 

												See Previous Recorded Events Here! ¬ª

http://marketing.swe.org/e/858553/events/4w7c28/460008196?h=vgm7abF1EsipmE0_ZWw2MMGrYK2Wc8VC_AU7dfA86nQ

									 

http://marketing.swe.org/e/858553/2023-04-26/4w7c2c/460008196?h=vgm7abF1EsipmE0_ZWw2MMGrYK2Wc8VC_AU7dfA86nQ

http://marketing.swe.org/e/858553/courses-44301/4w7c2g/460008196?h=vgm7abF1EsipmE0_ZWw2MMGrYK2Wc8VC_AU7dfA86nQ

									Project Management Skills For Project Managers

									SWE‚Äôs four-part eLearning course

http://marketing.swe.org/e/858553/courses-44301/4w7c2g/460008196?h=vgm7abF1EsipmE0_ZWw2MMGrYK2Wc8VC_AU7dfA86nQ

 is designed to teach project managers essential engineering project management skills. The interactive modules will walk project managers through essential project management skills that project managers should know, but may not have had training on. This project is based upon work partially supported by the generosity of Cummins, Inc. 

									 

									Compliance Training Courses on the Advance Learning Center 

									Compliance training is crucial for organizations to ensure legal compliance, manage risks, improve performance, and promote ethical conduct. They can help employees understand their roles and responsibilities within an organization and ensure they perform their duties effectively and efficiently. Because of this, the following compliance training courses are offered for free to SWE members.

									 

									Preventing Harassment and Discrimination

http://marketing.swe.org/e/858553/courses-47891/4w7c2k/460008196?h=vgm7abF1EsipmE0_ZWw2MMGrYK2Wc8VC_AU7dfA86nQ

States now recommend or require engineers to show proof of sexual harassment prevention training when renewing their license, with some states require specific training content for certification. As a result, SWE offers the Preventing Harassment and Discrimination course

http://marketing.swe.org/e/858553/courses-47891/4w7c2k/460008196?h=vgm7abF1EsipmE0_ZWw2MMGrYK2Wc8VC_AU7dfA86nQ

 on the Advance Learning Center. The interactive modules within the course provide tools for promoting respectful workplace behavior, complying with regulations, and managing bias. Choose only the relevant sections for your state. This course offers a digital badge through Credly upon completion of the course.

									 

									Ethics & Compliance

http://marketing.swe.org/e/858553/courses-50184/4w7c2n/460008196?h=vgm7abF1EsipmE0_ZWw2MMGrYK2Wc8VC_AU7dfA86nQ

									Designed to support corporations in maintaining a globally compliant and principled business environment, the interactive modules within the Ethics & Compliance course

http://marketing.swe.org/e/858553/courses-50184/4w7c2n/460008196?h=vgm7abF1EsipmE0_ZWw2MMGrYK2Wc8VC_AU7dfA86nQ

 will provide employees and supervisors with proper guidance on ethical issues and mandated regulations pertaining to workplace conduct and anti-corruption.

									 

									 

									People & Culture

http://marketing.swe.org/e/858553/courses-50185/4w7c2r/460008196?h=vgm7abF1EsipmE0_ZWw2MMGrYK2Wc8VC_AU7dfA86nQ

Strengthen your skills in effective management of an organization‚Äôs most important resource: people. The interactive modules within the People & Culture course

http://marketing.swe.org/e/858553/courses-50185/4w7c2r/460008196?h=vgm7abF1EsipmE0_ZWw2MMGrYK2Wc8VC_AU7dfA86nQ

 are designed to provide the learner with the necessary human resource skills to identify and interview good candidates, and make smart recruiting decisions that follow the law, learn when and why employers should conduct investigations and how to plan and conduct an effective investigation, and equip managers with the tools they need to terminate employees with compassion and respect.

									 

									Social Media Privacy

http://marketing.swe.org/e/858553/courses-50186/4w7c2v/460008196?h=vgm7abF1EsipmE0_ZWw2MMGrYK2Wc8VC_AU7dfA86nQ

									The Social Media Privacy

http://marketing.swe.org/e/858553/courses-50186/4w7c2v/460008196?h=vgm7abF1EsipmE0_ZWw2MMGrYK2Wc8VC_AU7dfA86nQ

 course is designed to provide employees and supervisors an understanding of social media responsibility both at work and at home. By raising awareness of the laws surrounding online privacy, social media use, and employment, this course helps employees and supervisors understand the importance of maintaining clear boundaries between their personal and professional lives while online, as well as offers helpful tips for responsible social media management and use.

									 

									Earn Digital Credentials through the Advance Learning Center!

http://marketing.swe.org/e/858553/courses-50619/4w7c2y/460008196?h=vgm7abF1EsipmE0_ZWw2MMGrYK2Wc8VC_AU7dfA86nQ

SWE‚Äôs new badging  program allows users to earn digital credentials by successfully completing SWE programs, attesting to leadership experience, and by completing courses in the Advance Learning Center. Badges can be used in email signatures, shared via social media, and are a helpful way to communicate your professional accomplishments. This month we are excited to highlight the Transforming the Boardroom badge. 

									This badge is for women who currently or previously served on a corporate board for a minimum of two years.  If you meet this criteria, we encourage you to complete this short attestation qui

http://marketing.swe.org/e/858553/courses-50619/4w7c2y/460008196?h=vgm7abF1EsipmE0_ZWw2MMGrYK2Wc8VC_AU7dfA86nQ

z on the Advance Learning Center to receive this badge and to be able to share your accomplishments with the world!

									 

 

http://marketing.swe.org/e/858553/TDtKJYnW9We6w-edit-ts-636bc79f/4w7c32/460008196?h=vgm7abF1EsipmE0_ZWw2MMGrYK2Wc8VC_AU7dfA86nQ

-1505246764.subject: Breaking: Convicted Ex-Harvard Chemist Charles Lieber Spared Additional Prison, Will Serve Six Months House Arrest
-1505246764.text:
[https://static.thecrimson.com/images/seal.jpg]The Harvard CrimsonApril 26, 2023
News Alert

Convicted Ex-Harvard Chemist Charles Lieber Spared Additional Prison, Will Serve
Six Months House Arrest
[https://thecrimson.us6.list-manage.com/track/click?u=21a413551b92cd36a65d3d13b&id=b55765a7f3&e=dacfcfcb95]
Convicted Ex-Harvard Chemist Charles Lieber Spared Additional Prison, Will Serve
Six Months House Arrest
[https://s3.amazonaws.com/thumbnails.thecrimson.com/photos/2021/12/20/181904_1353465.jpg.548x356_q95_crop-smart_upscale.jpg]https://thecrimson.us6.list-manage.com/track/click?u=21a413551b92cd36a65d3d13b&id=f84d07e10e&e=dacfcfcb95
 * Former Harvard chemistry professor Charles M. Lieber was spared additional
   time in prison by a federal judge on Wednesday and ordered to serve six
   months of house arrest, after he was convicted of lying to government
   investigators about his ties to China.
 * Judge Rya W. Zobel ‚Äô53 sentenced Lieber to one day in prison ‚Äî time that the
   chemist had already served following his arrest ‚Äî during a hearing at the
   John Joseph Moakley United States Courthouse, as well as half-a-year of house
   arrest and a $50,000 fine. Lieber hugged his attorney, Marc L. Mukasey, after
   the hearing.
   Read Story ‚ûû
   [https://thecrimson.us6.list-manage.com/track/click?u=21a413551b92cd36a65d3d13b&id=2f0f031b71&e=dacfcfcb95]

-2058589490.subject: Princeton Tutoring Session Recap (Record 27693)
-2058589490.text:
This recap was sent from Princeton Tutoring's mail servers. If you would like to respond to the tutor, please REPLY ALL to this email. Thanks.

  Student: Azeem Aslam
  Tutor: Eelaaf Zahid
  Subject(s): Pre-Algebra
  Date: 04/20/2023
  Location: Online
  Time Tutored: 16:30 - 17:30
  Next Scheduled Session: Thu, 04/27  4:30 PM (https://harvard.zoom.us/j/98039213216?pwd=RlcxVnRnSDN6aWlGOGhEK1RvYkRyQT09)

  Material Covered:
  We first reviewed the homework. Azeem did well with almost all of the percent word problems that were assigned for homework. Afterwards, I gave Azeem a hard percent word problems worksheet that had 2 step problems. At first Azeem struggled to figure out how to solve the problems. After I walked him through a problem, Azeem was able to work through the other problems more individually. He showed clear understanding of the parts of each proportion and what value he was solving for in each proportion. I have included homework for non-percent proportion problems for homework. 

  Additional Comments:
  Dear Janelle,

I had a great session with Azeem last week. By the end of the session, he had a more individual approach to percent word problems, which I hope will translate over to the proportion word problems in the homework.

If you have any questions or concerns, please let me know. 

Regards,

Eelaaf 

  Assignments for Next Week:
  Please find the homework in the google drive. 

https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1e51Q_DRP-ag790OXKK_C-Mg_8y5TcL30?usp=sharing

-993720558.subject: [hcs-d] Xfund Xperiment Stake Application Due 4/30
-993720558.text:
Hi HCS,

In a first-of-its-kind collaboration, Harvard Undergraduate Capital
Partners, Harvard Student Agencies, Harvard Venture Capital Group, Harvard
Women in Computer Science, HBS Tech Club, Harvard Ventures, Harvard
Computer Society, and Xfund present the Xperiment Stake: Xfund.com/xperiment
<http://xfund.com/xperiment>.

The Xperiment is an opportunity to receive a minimum $100,000 investment in
your startup. We are looking for a team committed to building its company
full-time after graduation, whenever that may be. Harvard students of all
years in school may apply. No team is too early and all verticals are fair
game for this Xperiment.

We can‚Äôt wait to review your application!

Best,
Michael
‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî
Michael Zhao
Harvard College | Class of 2025

_______________________________________________
hcs-discuss mailing list
hcs-discuss@lists.hcs.harvard.edu
https://lists.hcs.harvard.edu/mailman/listinfo/hcs-discuss

Partners in Crime: Gratitude Increases Corrupt Collaboration
Ke Wang

Relationships Between Irritability and Ventromedial Prefrontal Cortex, Nucleus Accumbens, and Basolateral Amygdala Structural Volumes and Structural Connectivity in Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder
Elizabeth Wang

Brain Reactivity to Personalized Alcohol Cues is Related to Severity of Alcohol Use Disorder But Not Subjective Craving in Treatment-Seeking Adults
Julia C. Welsh

Tend-and-Befriend Stress Response and Chronic Stress: Social Risks as Effect Modifiers of the Relationship between Social Support and Psychological Well-Being During the COVID-19 Pandemic
Peyton Williams

-43775567.subject: [ADAMS] Bike for sale
-43775567.text:
Hey Adams -

I am a current senior that is going to be graduating next month and will no
longer be needing my bike. I will be selling the bike + u-lock + bike pump
+ spare seat for $275 or best offer. Bike was originally $600 on its own so
good deal. Downside is does need a new back tire because I have popped it
due to my size. Attached is a picture of the bike below. Reach out if you
are interested @ 949-395-0136.

_______________________________________________
Check the Adams FAQ for answers to many common questions: http://adamshouse.harvard.edu/frequently-asked-questions

-2070953929.subject: PacBot competition this week!
-2070953929.text:
The PacBot competition is *this Saturday*!  The competition will run from
9am to 6pm approximately.  We will serve breakfast and lunch.  Please do
come!  We could use some help making sure the event runs smoothly.

There will also be a couple of work sessions in preparation for the
competition:

   - Basically all day on Thursday.
   - Friday evening, starting at roughly 4pm.  Maker's Collective is
   hosting a Make Night on Friday from 5-7pm, so there will be food + chances
   to make other cool stuff, if you want.

Let me know if you have any questions.

See you soon!
- Daniel

-1369228885.subject: [Fyre] Selling 2 Mac Ayres Tickets for $40/each
-1369228885.text:
Hello! I bought 2 Mac Ayres concert tickets that I no longer am able to
attend. Selling for cheaper that what I bought them for/current resale
value!

The tickets are for General Admission on Friday (April 28) at the
Roadrunner in Boston.

Reply if you're interested!
[image: Screen Shot 2023-04-26 at 3.52.05 PM.png]

-903061278.subject: [Fyre] Want $100?! Climate Art Competition
-903061278.text:
*The Harvard Center for International Development's Global Empowerment
Meeting*, in partnership with the *Harvard Climate Coalition*, is hosting a
climate art competition for students to submit their work in alignment with
the theme of the conference, *GEM23: **‚ÄúGEM23: "Growing in a Green World
<https://www.hks.harvard.edu/gem>."*

[image: Climate Art Poster.png]

*Submissions are open to artistic interpretation, and all forms of media
are encouraged. Submission types may include but are not limited to
drawing, painting, photography, mixed media, digital art, video, dance,
fiber arts, pottery, and poetry. *

*Five winners will receive the prize of a $100 Visa Gift Card*.
Additionally, all artists will have the opportunity to showcase their work
and themselves as artists in relation to climate and environment during a
90-minute session at the meeting to attendees. (Some artwork may only be
able to be presented in digital format.)

*Submissions are due via this FINAL SUBMISSION
<https://forms.gle/3yCJjDv5PxG9XSBm9>** form by 11:59 pm on Monday, May
1st.* Artists planning on submitting are highly encouraged to fill out the
preliminary INTEREST <https://forms.gle/npSghVtRfquXVovg7> form as soon as
possible.
Questions should be directed to kianiakina@college.harvard.edu with the
subject line [Art Competition Question]

-2001156675.text:
RESERVE YOUR FREE TICKETS NOW!
<https://us14.mailchimp.com/mctx/clicks?url=https%3A%2F%2Fdocs.google.com%2Fforms%2Fd%2Fe%2F1FAIpQLScrWZu35UXnQMbBLIFClaiyl9QwWrdRnPv8fU0D0bdytXCGqQ%2Fviewform&xid=c54dfca24b&uid=190657762&iid=f5fce17982&pool=cts&v=2&c=1682564834&h=5bc4cec5b101517f828d95a43a29000dc3b5c896a7b3128d35a4f14c75ca6e97>

At Google, an artificial intelligence named Denise has written a play and
the company has hired a downtown troupe of theatre performers to help her
develop it, but rehearsals start to eat away at the edges of reality, and
soon we're unsure if we're watching a play or watching reality, watching
humans perform characters or watching characters perform being human.





*Thursday April 27th @ 7pmFriday April 28th @ 7pmSaturday April 29th @
2pmSaturday April 29th @ 7pmSunday April 30th @ 2pm*

The performance will be held at Farkas Hall
(12 Holyoke St, Cambridge, MA 02138)

The SWE Early Career Professionals Affinity Group (ECP AG) welcomes you to apply for the FY24 Leadership Team. The ECP AG‚Äôs mission is to foster a welcoming, supportive, and inclusive culture through networking, professional development, and aiding in the recruitment and development of early career SWE professionals.

									 

									We welcome all graduating collegiate seniors, graduate students, and individuals in the first 10 years of their career to apply. You can find information about the ECP AG Leadership Team and indicate your interest by completing the short application: ECP AG FY24 Call for Leadership Form

http://marketing.swe.org/e/858553/ib9mXTUs3AYfbG2s8/4w7j6g/460751872?h=-ceRCDXADpIbNokU7STg7k40pLIV6F6DBe91U0-_iD4

. Applications are due on Friday, May 5 at 11:59 pm EDT. 

									We look forward to your applications and do not hesitate to reach out if you have any questions!

									SWE Early Career Professionals Affinity Group 

									Co-Leads: Marie-Pierre (MP) Delisle & Mahati Vavilala

									ecp_ag@swe.org

mailto:ecp_ag@swe.org

									 

												Apply Before May 5 ¬ª

http://marketing.swe.org/e/858553/ib9mXTUs3AYfbG2s8/4w7j6g/460751872?h=-ceRCDXADpIbNokU7STg7k40pLIV6F6DBe91U0-_iD4

									The purpose of this email is to publicize a program or activity sponsored by the Society of Women Engineers (SWE). You are receiving this email because you are either a SWE member or have an affiliation with SWE. All SWE members may login to the SWE portal to manage and update their email preferences

http://marketing.swe.org/e/858553/s-login--startURL-2Fs2F/4w7j6k/460751872?h=-ceRCDXADpIbNokU7STg7k40pLIV6F6DBe91U0-_iD4

. Everyone, including non-members, may unsubscribe from all SWE email communications here

http://marketing.swe.org/unsubscribeConfirm/858553/730dc36aa2accab8712aaca4fdfc4230640d51abbf0384c92bcae7f3e7ff213c/460751872

. Due to their leadership responsibilities, all active SWE leaders will continue to receive SWE business emails even if they opt-out of marketing emails. Current SWE members may receive business critical emails and/or renewal emails even if they opt-out of marketing emails. To remove your email address from SWE's database entirely, email membership@swe.org

-706372767.subject: Geometry - Tutoring Oppty
-706372767.text:
Hi all,

Please see below for a Geometry opportunity.

All tutoring opportunities are posted to this *Google Spreadsheet (Std
Tutoring Opps)*
<https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1T3iL7t433tOe7IBzQKyHTXjFzs4DejJk2a7W0VzwBBM/edit?usp=sharing>
 (and updated in real-time) -- please bookmark for future reference!

If you're interested in any tutoring opportunities (or have any questions),
then please respond to this email (tutormatching@princetontutoring.com).

Kind regards,
*Elizabeth*

*Geometry (Online)*
 #JRPR

   - *FYI: this is a potential opportunity for an interested client. The
   client hasn't signed up yet. We are reaching out to gauge tutor interest.*
   - This 8th grader lives in Hawaii & is taking Geometry class to get into
   higher level math. Needs tutor to help w/ foundations & keep him on track
   w/ a guided course that sends readings/HW/quizzes.
   - Interests/activities: soccer, basketball, video games
   - Personality: funny, kind, easy to work with, motivated to learn.
   - Preferences for tutor: offers resources to reference-e.g. saved notes
   (whiteboards, etc), recordings of sessions
   - *Logistics:* Online
   - *Frequency:* 1-2x/week in May, 3x/week in June
   - *Availability: *May- Tues/Thurs 4:30-6:30pm Hawaii time, more
   flexibility on Weekends & starting in June when school's out.
   - *Duration:* Until Mid-late June
   - *Session length: *1 hr min
   - This opportunity pays your standard rate
   - *Tutor Tier: *Standard

---

*Elizabeth Smith *

Senior Operations Manager
Princeton Tutoring <http://princetontutoring.com/> / PrepMaven
<http://prepmaven.com/>

-- 
To unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it, send an email to tutors-princeton+unsubscribe@princetontutoring.com.

-351851112.subject: [hcs-d] AI Safety Social today (4/27) at 8 pm
-351851112.text:
Join the *Harvard AI Safety Team (HAIST)* *today* (*4/27*) at *8 pm* for
our *final social of the semester*. Come to discuss & debate AI Safety,
meet the HAIST members, and eat dinner & snacks. :)

*Location*: *HAIST office* (66 Church St, Cambridge, 2nd floor).
*Time*: *8-11 pm, today* (Thursday, April 27)

*About us:* The *Harvard AI Safety Team* is a student group conducting
research to *reduce risks from advanced AI*. We think that reducing risks
from advanced artificial intelligence may be one of the most important
problems of our time. We also think it‚Äôs a* highly interesting* *and
exciting problem*, with *open opportunities *for many more researchers to
make progress on it.

If you have trouble finding the office, call me at 425-531-9881. Hope to
see you there!

Best,
Naomi

Naomi Bashkansky
425-531-9881
Harvard '25, Computer Science
Events Director at HAIST (haist.ai)

https://lists.hcs.harvard.edu/mailman/listinfo/hcs-discuss

-235554956.subject: Re: [ADAMS] Another Book Giveaway
-235554956.text:
Tonight at 7:45 in the Brower Room!

On Tue, Apr 25, 2023 at 3:32 PM Santiago Pardo S√°nchez <
santiagopardo@g.harvard.edu> wrote:

> Hi Schmooze,
>
> The Library will be giving away "abandoned books" this Thursday at 7:45pm
> in the Brower Room.
>
> What's an abandoned book? It's a book that former students have left
> behind when they move out in hopes that the House Library will take them.
> We don't have the space to keep all the books we've been "given" the last
> couple of years, so we want to give them a new home.
>
> As an added incentive, donate to one of the Gradams boxes we'll have
> available and skip the line!
>
> As ever,
> Santi
>

_______________________________________________
Check the Adams FAQ for answers to many common questions: http://adamshouse.harvard.edu/frequently-asked-questions

-1366017798.subject: Re: [ADAMS] Summer Housing Available
-1366017798.text:
Just wanted to bump this for anyone interested.

On Sat, Apr 22, 2023 at 1:15‚ÄØPM Jacob Buehler <
jacobbuehler@college.harvard.edu> wrote:

> Good evening Adams,
>
>
> If you, or someone you know, are looking for summer 2023 housing in
> Cambridge MA, please read this email!
>
>
> This is a 6 bedroom, 2 bathroom condo, located at 17 Putnam Avenue. Rent
> for 1 bedroom is $1,500-$1,700/month, depending on the room. Location is
> just 5 minutes from Harvard Square! Anyone is welcome to sublet, whether
> you are a grad student, undergraduate, working full-time, etc.
>
>
> Please find photos attached here:
> https://www.zillow.com/homedetails/17-Putnam-Ave-Cambridge-MA-02139/2127743744_zpid/ (FYI:
> this is an old listing, just here for informative purposes)
>
>
> If you are interested, please reach out to: Jacob Buehler (203 536 3837) (
> jacobbuehler@college.harvard.edu)
>
>
>
> Best,
>
> Jacob Buehler
>

-379498769.subject: College Econ (Short-term/Urgent) - Tutoring Oppty
-379498769.text:
Hi all,

Please see below for a College Econ (Short-term/Urgent) opportunity.

All tutoring opportunities are posted to this *Google Spreadsheet (Std
Tutoring Opps)*
<https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1T3iL7t433tOe7IBzQKyHTXjFzs4DejJk2a7W0VzwBBM/edit?usp=sharing>
 (and updated in real-time) -- please bookmark for future reference!

If you're interested in any tutoring opportunities (or have any questions),
then please respond to this email (tutormatching@princetontutoring.com).

Kind regards,
*Elizabeth*

*College Econ (Short-term/Urgent) (Online) *
#ELAN

   - *FYI: this is a potential opportunity for an interested client. The
   client hasn't signed up yet. We are reaching out to gauge tutor interest.*
   - This college jr at Wellesley needs Econ support. Struggled on & off,
   final is this Monday. More course info here
   <https://catalog.wellesley.edu/courses.php?pos=28&doc_type=econ+-+economics+co>
   under ECON 204.
   - *Logistics:* Online
   - *Frequency:* As much as possible
   - *Availability: *Flexible after 12pm on Sat, After 5pm on Friday/Sunday
   - *Duration:* Until Monday 5/1
   - *Session length: *1 hr min
   - This opportunity pays your standard rate plus $5/hour
   - *Tutor Tier: *Standard

---

*Elizabeth Smith *

Senior Operations Manager
Princeton Tutoring <http://princetontutoring.com/> / PrepMaven
<http://prepmaven.com/>

-- 
To unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it, send an email to tutors-princeton+unsubscribe@princetontutoring.com.

-1277298153.subject: Weekly Update April 27
-1277298153.text:
International Relations on Campus; Lowell House Bacchanalia; VERDI Requiem;  Sudan Relief


** Weekly Update
------------------------------------------------------------
Thursday, April 27, 2023


** Connect
------------------------------------------------------------
International Relations on Campus are holding a forum today at 5:00 PM where Iraqi students will share their perspectives on the 20th anniversary of the US's invasion of Iraq. Fill out this form (https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdrPiq-fLWH0UJ3C_H6nA8vEqwoqKqi5eTxhR9eBCKjSrZuNA/viewform) to indicate your interest in the event.

Let yourself get lost in a labyrinth at Bacchanalia, Lowell House's spring formal! Get tickets (http://bit.ly/bacchanalia2023)  to enjoy live music, a champagne tower, Greek food, and more on Saturday, April 29 at 9:30 PM.

The Harvard Choruses and the Harvard-Radcliffe Orchestra (HRO) perform VERDI Requiem (https://www.boxoffice.harvard.edu/Online/default.asp?BOparam::WScontent::loadArticle::permalink=harvard-radcliffe-orchestra&BOparam::WScontent::loadArticle::context_id=) on Sunday, April 30 at 3:00 PM in Sanders Theater. Under the baton of HRO music director Federico Cortese, 250 Harvard students will perform alongside world-renowned soloists.

The Society of Arab Students (SAS), Harvard Islamic Society, and Harvard African Students Association are partnering to fundraise for medical relief efforts in Sudan. Learn more at the SAS Instagram (https://www.instagram.com/sasharvard/) .


** Resources and Opportunities
------------------------------------------------------------
Mignone Center for Career Success events (https://careerservices.fas.harvard.edu/events/page/3/) from Thursday, April 27 through Wednesday, May 3 include Consulting Recruiting: Job and Internship Success Series, a Harvard Law School Site Visit, Tech Recruiting: Job and Internship Success Series, and more.

Join the Lemann Program on Creativity & Entrepreneurship and Reimagining Experiential Education and Fabrication Makerspace to see Harvard creatives debut fashion containing marine debris at the Marine Debris Fashion Show (https://www.lpce.college.harvard.edu/marine-debris-fashio-show-and-challenge)  on Thursday, April 27 at 8:00 PM in Science Center Plaza.

Discover an ARTStravaganza from Thursday, April 27-Sunday, April 30 at ARTS FIRST, Harvard‚Äôs annual celebration of creativity! Produced by the Office for the Arts, the festival features free performances and artwork (https://calendar.college.harvard.edu/artsfirstfestival#tabs-34122683978676-34122683989944) by students, staff, faculty, alums, and affiliates in and around Harvard Yard.

Harvard Art Museums events:
* Harvard Art Museums at Night (https://harvardartmuseums.org/calendar/harvard-art-museums-at-night-12?utm_source=museummarketing&utm_medium=listing&utm_campaign=April+At+Night&utm_id=April+Harvard+Art+Museums+at+Night) , this evening from 5:00 - 9:00 PM
* ARTS FIRST at the Harvard Art Museums (https://harvardartmuseums.org/calendar/arts-first-at-the-harvard-art-museums-performance-fair-in-the-calderwood-courtyard-and-adolphus-busch-hall?utm_source=museummarketing&utm_medium=listing&utm_campaign=Arts+First+Performance&utm_id=ARTS+FIRST+at+the+Harvard+Art+Museums%3A+Performance+Fair+in+the+Calderwood+Courtyard+and+Adolphus+Busch+Hall) : Performance Fair in the Calderwood Courtyard and Adolphus Busch Hall on Saturday, April 29 from 1:00-5:00 PM.
* Gallery Talk: Paintings in Residence‚ÄîWorks from the Terra Foundation for American Art (https://harvardartmuseums.org/calendar/gallery-talk-paintings-in-residence-works-from-the-terra-foundation-for-american-art-3?utm_source=museummarketing&utm_medium=listing&utm_campaign=Terra+Foundation+May+3&utm_id=Gallery+Talk%3A+Paintings+in+Residence%E2%80%94Works+from+the+Terra+Foundation+for+American+Art) on Wednesday, May 3 from 12:30-1:00 PM.

Graduate School of Education Askwith Education Forum events:
* The Real World of College (https://web.cvent.com/event/0d1ef7db-c304-4974-b760-8a89c11076e2/regProcessStep1?RefId=HC%20Update) on Monday, May 1 from 6:00-7:00 PM.
* Education, Truth, and the Future of Democracy (https://web.cvent.com/event/c2b5dc8d-9e90-4269-a85d-083f108191d0/regProcessStep1?RefId=HC%20Update) on Thursday, May 4 from 4:30-6:00 PM.
* Building Our Resilient Future: Education Driving Hope, Innovation, and Action (https://web.cvent.com/event/9e179842-7444-4028-aca8-3bd581802d5f/regProcessStep1?RefId=HC%20Update)  on Wednesday, May 10 from 10:00 AM - 2:00 PM.

Apply to the Harvard Kennedy School Program on Science, Technology & Society (http://sts.hks.harvard.edu) 's (http://sts.hks.harvard.edu/) Fall Undergraduate Fellowship (http://sts.hks.harvard.edu/) . Fellows will explore ways of grappling with contemporary problems of science and technology as they intersect with policy, politics, and governance. Learn more and apply (http://tinyurl.com/undergradfellowsf23) by Saturday, May 13.

Join the Office of the Vice Provost for Special Projects for an engaging conversation with Roeshana Moore-Evans and Sara Bleich at Harvard & the Legacy of Slavery: Our Path Forward on Tuesday, May 16 from 11:30 AM - 12:30 PM. Register (https://www.harvard.edu/vice-provost-for-special-projects/1268-2/)  by Tuesday, May 9.


** Athletics
------------------------------------------------------------
Come cheer on Harvard Men‚Äôs Lightweight Rowing this Saturday, April 29 at 8:15 AM as they host Yale and Princeton in the Goldthwait & Vogel Cups. Make sure to stop by the race day table for a free bucket hat.

Join Harvard Baseball at O‚ÄôDonnell Field as they host Columbia on Saturday, April 29 at 11:30 AM. Stop by the gameday table for a free rope hat.

Come cheer on Harvard Men‚Äôs Lacrosse as they take on Yale at Jordan Field in their regular season finale this Saturday, April 29 at 12:00 PM. Get a free long sleeve T and a laptop sticker of your House Crest at the gameday table. The House with the largest turnout will get free pizza during finals week!


** Dates and Deadlines
------------------------------------------------------------
May 4-13: Final Examination Period
May 15: Course evaluation (Q Guide) closes
May 22: All grades released
May 25: Commencement

For more dates and events, visit the Harvard College Calendar (https://calendar.college.harvard.edu/) .
Submit announcements and feedback ‚ûî (https://forms.gle/akC1rDF8A2MxZgCd6)

wrote:

> Hi all!
>
> If you're a graduating senior and looking to stay in touch with WiCS after

>

>

-548863848.subject: Re: [Adams-molotov] HELP SAVE THE PRESS/OUR STATUS AS THE BEST HOUSE (i told u there would be more emails)
-548863848.text:
If you have a few spare minutes this reading period, consider also emailing
the deans! Salmaan and Meche have expressed wanting to hear from people by
email (idk why). If you really have no time, just copy and paste from the
petition and send it as an email to the addresses below! It'll take 1
minute and it can help save the Press for future generations of Adams :)

Meche's email: Mercedes_Becerra@hms.harvard.edu

Today your gift is  
https://click.connect.americanpublicmedia.org/?qs=0b9fd17c89fa66c722e1e321b8b50dd413505889df41446c8e9b45c042625db34f53d7be59365d2257514939529c51c058ec1499511659c2 
doubled
https://click.connect.americanpublicmedia.org/?qs=0b9fd17c89fa66c722e1e321b8b50dd413505889df41446c8e9b45c042625db34f53d7be59365d2257514939529c51c058ec1499511659c2 
 thanks to fellow listeners Charles P. Pfleeger and Shari Lawrence Pfleeger who have provided a $5,000 match to help us end National Poetry Month strong. 





 I had always thought my friendships would last forever, but life subverts the noblest of intentions. So, kudos to all those who have stayed friends without the aide of an algorithm or social media platform.       

   
— Major

Tea with Ann
 by Mary Brancaccio



I don’t know when we started our habit

of long talks over pots of tea

 

or why it felt so familiar.

 

And I wonder if we’d been born

elsewhere, would we have met


in a post office line, or waiting


for a bus, instead of

in the cafeteria


at Bishop O’Connell


sophomore year?

I was the one eating alone
when you came along.

 

But it seems as if

I can’t imagine growing old

 

without you.

 

Who else will laugh

at the point of no return

 

from the priest’s lecture on loss

of virginity, played on a tinny cassette

 

to a classroom of horny sixteen

year-olds, all bucking to lose it

 

by graduation? I still can’t pass

that donut shop in Vienna 

 

without feeling queasy over creme puffs

 

after you and I got high and you taught me

how creme-filled donuts were made.

 

And didn’t we talk the dawn in

over mothers and lovers,

 

the ones we lost, the ones we buried.

Only you understand the gap that grew

 

between ourselves and our brothers,

after our mothers died.

 

And the aging fathers we loved,

god, how they wore us down.

 

I promise this summer, no really,

I’ll help you tame your back lot.

 

The kids and I will be over.

 

I’ll bring a rake and pruning shears.

You’ll put on a pot of tea.
“Tea With Ann” by Mary Brancaccio from

-817277951.subject: Special Report: Dan Schrag, Top Harvard Climate Scientist, Faces Allegations of Bullying and Toxicity Spanning Two Decades
-817277951.text:
[https://static.thecrimson.com/images/seal.jpg]The Harvard CrimsonApril 28, 2023
Special Report Newsletter

Dan Schrag, Top Harvard Climate Scientist, Faces Allegations of Bullying and
Toxicity Spanning Two Decades
[https://thecrimson.us6.list-manage.com/track/click?u=21a413551b92cd36a65d3d13b&id=3b3a11c34f&e=dacfcfcb95]
Dan Schrag, Top Harvard Climate Scientist, Faces Allegations of Bullying and
Toxicity Spanning Two Decades
[https://s3.amazonaws.com/thumbnails.thecrimson.com/photos/2023/04/28/052031_1363582.png.474x356_q95_crop-smart_upscale.png]https://thecrimson.us6.list-manage.com/track/click?u=21a413551b92cd36a65d3d13b&id=4aeec96910&e=dacfcfcb95
 * A nationally respected voice on climate science and policy, Harvard professor
   Daniel P. Schrag faced disciplinary measures in 2021 after students and staff
   raised concerns about his professional conduct.
 * In interviews over the past year, more than two dozen current and former
   students, staff, colleagues have said Schrag created a poor working
   environment for those around him ‚Äî¬†allegations spanning two decades. Schrag
   often undermined subordinates and emphasized the power he held over their
   careers, fostering a culture of distrust and fear, students and staff said.
   Read Story ‚ûû
   [https://thecrimson.us6.list-manage.com/track/click?u=21a413551b92cd36a65d3d13b&id=2591112eaf&e=dacfcfcb95]

-1030927210.subject: Re: [HUES] Elections TODAY from 1-4 pm
-1030927210.text:
Hi all,

If you can't attend in person, please use this link
<https://harvard.zoom.us/j/95859625836?pwd=RE1ZcGZTLzZLZTE2U0tPMHhnemJ6Zz09> to
enter the zoom call for today's elections.

Otherwise, see you in Sever 103 very soon!

On Fri, Apr 28, 2023 at 9:14‚ÄØAM Maycee Wieczorek <
mwieczorek@college.harvard.edu> wrote:

> Hey engineers!
>
> CORRECTION: Elections will be held today from *1-4.* Updated candidacy
> statements for 2023-2024 HUES Board positions are attached below!
>
> *The election will take place TODAY on Friday**, April 28th *from 1:00PM
> - 4:00PM EDT*, but will likely not take the entire allocated time.* We
> will be meeting in *Sever Hall, room 102. * Everyone is invited to join
> us! Please take part in choosing the individuals who will be representing
> our engineers in this board next year.
>
>
> Because the meeting is relatively long, voters can come and go, but *if
> you're running for a position please try to stay the whole time. **If you
> are running for a position, but are unable to attend
> the election deliberations, please email **mollybosworth@college.harvard.edu
> <mollybosworth@college.harvard.edu>** as soon as possible.*
>
>
> *Please email Molly (mollybosworth@college.harvard.edu
> <mollybosworth@college.harvard.edu>) with any questions!*
>
> A reminder about voting/election procedures is below.
>
> *Voting/Election:*
>
>
>    - *The election is open to all members of the hues-open list who would
>    like to come for deliberations and voting.*
>    - Because the meeting is relatively long, voters can come and go, but *if
>    you're running for a position please try to stay the whole time (please let
>    us know if you can only stay part of the time.)*
>    -  Please keep speeches to under 3 minutes.
>    - You may not take part in the deliberations for any position you are
>    running for; you will be in a different room while deliberations happen
>    among voters.
>    - For each position, the candidate with the most votes will
>    be elected - for positions with 2 chairs, the candidates with the top 2
>    most votes will be elected.
>
> Please let Molly <mollybosworth@college.harvard.edu> know if you have any
> questions, and we hope to see lots of you at 1:00!
> --
> Maycee Wieczorek
> Harvard College Class of 2024
> S.B Candidate in Mechanical Engineering
>
> --
> You received this message because you are subscribed to the Google Groups
> "HUES Open List" group.
> To unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it, send an
> email to hues-open-list+unsubscribe@googlegroups.com.
> To view this discussion on the web visit
> https://groups.google.com/d/msgid/hues-open-list/CAGCz6%2Bnc5Jb2no%3DcjwUYOrN7BVUz%3DqkChEZ86BWgptBr8xgFRg%40mail.gmail.com
> <https://groups.google.com/d/msgid/hues-open-list/CAGCz6%2Bnc5Jb2no%3DcjwUYOrN7BVUz%3DqkChEZ86BWgptBr8xgFRg%40mail.gmail.com?utm_medium=email&utm_source=footer>
> .
>


-- 
*Molly Bosworth*
Pronouns: she/they
S.B. Candidate in Electrical Engineering
Harvard College, Class of 2024

*Email:* mollybosworth@college.harvard.edu
*Mobile:* +1-857-999-6543
*Website: *mollybosworth.com

--

-883985787.subject: Precalc (Short-term), Alg 2 - Tutoring Oppty
-883985787.text:
Hi all,

Please see below for a Precalculus and Algebra 2 opportunity.

All tutoring opportunities are posted to this *Google Spreadsheet (Std
Tutoring Opps)*
<https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1T3iL7t433tOe7IBzQKyHTXjFzs4DejJk2a7W0VzwBBM/edit?usp=sharing>
 (and updated in real-time) -- please bookmark for future reference!

If you're interested in any tutoring opportunities (or have any questions),
then please respond to this email (tutormatching@princetontutoring.com).

Kind regards,
*Elizabeth*

*1 - Precalculus (Short-term) (Online)*
#MCME

   - This 11th grader needs general Precalc support, has fallen behind in
   class.
   - Interests/activities: basketball
   - Personality: shy
   - *Logistics:* Online
   - *Frequency:* 2-3x/week
   - *Availability: *Tue/Thu/Fridays after 3:30pm
   - *Duration:* 3 weeks
   - *Session length: *1 hr min
   - This opportunity pays your standard rate
   - *Tutor Tier: *Standard

*2 - *
*Algebra II (In-Person Only)* #
DSDS

   - *FYI: this is a potential opportunity for an interested client. The
   client hasn't signed up yet. We are reaching out to gauge tutor interest.*
   - This 9th grader has fallen behind in Alg 2 Accel (Cs). Misses
   questions on tests but doing ok on quizzes & HW.
   - Interests/activities: rowing, music, gym, reading, openAI & chatGPT.
   - Personality: motivated when interested, sometimes rushes through work
   & procrastinates
   - Preferences for tutor: engage him & understand what is holding him
   back, build proper habits (like showing work), patience, help with
   structure/discipline.
   - *Logistics:* In-Person Only (PPL or In-home)
   - *Frequency:* 1x/week to start
   - *Availability:* Wed/Thu at 7:30pm, Saturdays, Sunday
   mornings/afternoons
   - *Duration:* Through end of school year
   - *Session length:* 1 hr min
   - This opportunity pays your standard rate plus $5/hour (in-person). If
   in-home, there would be compensation for transportation/travel time (5 min
   drive from Princeton campus).
   - *Tutor Tier: *Standard

---

*Elizabeth Smith *

Senior Operations Manager
Princeton Tutoring <http://princetontutoring.com/> / PrepMaven
<http://prepmaven.com/>

-- 
To unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it, send an email to tutors-princeton+unsubscribe@princetontutoring.com.

-1742153101.subject: Extended Stay and Summer Housing Options
-1742153101.text:
https://registrar.fas.harvard.edu/?utm_source=announcement&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=home&utm_content=preheader


** megaphone icon ANNOUNCEMENT
------------------------------------------------------------


** Extended Stay and Summer Housing Options
------------------------------------------------------------


** ‚Äî Applications are open in the residential portal
------------------------------------------------------------
Extended Stay and Summer Housing Details (https://dso.college.harvard.edu/summer-housing)
Dear Eelaaf,

There are a number of options available to students who need to remain on campus after May 14. You may be eligible for extended stay or summer housing as a graduating senior, cross-registered student, independent applicant (https://dso.college.harvard.edu/summer-housing?admin_panel=1#widget-6)  or as part of your work with a department or student organization (https://dso.college.harvard.edu/summer-housing?admin_panel=1#widget-2) . Alternatively, you may choose to rent an apartment (https://dso.college.harvard.edu/summer-housing?admin_panel=1#widget-5) from the College.


** Housing Dates & Deadlines
------------------------------------------------------------
Extended Stay (May 14 Up Until June 1)
You must submit an application in the residential portal (http://harvard.starrezhousing.com/starrezportalx)  no later than 9:00 AM on Monday, May 1.

Summer Housing (June 1 ‚Äì August 14)
You must submit an application in the residential portal (http://harvard.starrezhousing.com/starrezportalx)  no later than 9:00 AM on Friday, May 5


** Eligibility
------------------------------------------------------------
Graduating Seniors & Participants
If you are living on campus and attending Senior Week and Commencement as a graduate or participant, you may remain in your assigned housing until May 26 at 5:00 PM. If you are staying on campus, please reach out to your House Administrator (https://dso.college.harvard.edu/people/people-type/house-administrators) with questions. Participants are students attending this Commencement but graduating at another time.

Cross-Registered Students
If you are cross-registered in an MIT course and have a mandatory in-person academic commitment, you may remain on campus until one day after your required class or exam at no additional cost. Please register your stay via the residential portal (http://harvard.starrezhousing.com/starrezportalx)  and select Pre-Approved Groups.

Departments & Student Organizations
You may be eligible for summer housing through a student organization or department affiliation. They will notify you directly if you are eligible for housing and a meal plan and also if there is a cost to you.

Independent Requests
You may apply for extended stay and/or summer housing if you are facing housing insecurity and are unable to find alternate housing for some portion of Summer 2023. Availability is strictly limited to students who are unable to obtain housing due to health or safety concerns. We will begin sending decisions to students on Wednesday, May 3.


** Cost and Financial Support
------------------------------------------------------------
In response to student requests for better access to food and housing during the summer, the College is now providing meal plans with all extended stay and summer housing assignments for student organizations (https://dso.college.harvard.edu/summer-housing?admin_panel=1#widget-2) and students who apply independently (https://dso.college.harvard.edu/summer-housing?admin_panel=1#widget-6) .
* The combined housing and dining rate will be $45/night, and financial support will be available to those who qualify. In addition to housing, you will receive dining hall access for 3 meals per day. All students remaining on campus for Extended Stay or Summer Housing must participate in the meal plan. This will ensure equitable access to dining for all students living on campus.
* You will be billed the nightly rate for the entire time you are approved to be on campus, even if you are away from campus for a portion of the approved period.

Financial support:
If you request financial assistance, we will review your individual circumstances and partner with the Griffin Financial Aid Office to determine your eligibility. The level of financial support you will receive will be detailed in your housing offer email.
Extended Stay and Summer Housing Details (https://dso.college.harvard.edu/summer-housing)


** Rentals
------------------------------------------------------------
In addition to the options above, Harvard College is resuming its summer housing rental program (https://dso.college.harvard.edu/summer-housing?admin_panel=1#widget-5) . You can apply to rent an apartment, most commonly at 10 or 20 DeWolfe Street. Apartments include 2 bedroom / 4 bed units with kitchens and are rented as a whole unit.

License Period
The license period for Summer Rentals begins on Friday, June 9 and ends on Monday, August 14.

Cost
An apartment rental for the entire license period costs $6,360. You and up to 3 roommates are responsible for the full cost of the apartment regardless of the number of occupants. You are responsible for finding eligible roommates.

All rental apartments include kitchens. As such, the cost of rental housing does not include a meal plan; however, meal plans can be purchased at an additional cost of $1,980.


** calendar icon DEADLINES
------------------------------------------------------------
May
01

Deadline to Apply for Extended Stay Housing
Please apply via the residential portal (http://harvard.starrezhousing.com/starrezportalx) by May 1 at 9 AM to ensure timely processing of your application.
May
05

Deadline to Apply for Summer Housing
Please apply via the residential portal (http://harvard.starrezhousing.com/starrezportalx) by May 5 at 9 AM to ensure timely processing of your application.
May
14

Undergraduate Move-Out (https://dso.college.harvard.edu/move-out)
Students not approved for housing after May 14 must vacate their term time residence no later than 12 PM.
May
26

Senior Move-Out (https://dso.college.harvard.edu/move-out)
Seniors and Commencement participants must vacate their term time residences no later than 5 PM.
For additional details about eligibility, pricing, logistics, or application instructions,  please visit our extended stay and summer housing web page (https://dso.college.harvard.edu/summer-housing) .
Sincerely,

Harvard College Housing Office

============================================================
** Harvard Faculty of Arts and Sciences Office of Student Services (https://studentservices.fas.harvard.edu)
The Harvard College Housing Office is part of the Office of Student Services, serving Harvard College, GSAS, and SEAS.

-1194904386.subject: Before National Poetry Month comes to an end
-1194904386.text:
Don't miss this last opportunity to receive your Ada Lim√≥n notebook, our exclusive gift to donors

https://poets.org/donate/p/28/national-poetry-month?mc_cid=c9d0ba9c8f&mc_eid=UNIQID
Dear Reader,

I‚Äôm writing with a special request before National Poetry Month comes to an end: if you value our resources, including the poems we share each morning through Poem-a-Day and the thousands offered on Poets.org, please make a contribution to support our work (https://poets.org/donate/p/28/national-poetry-month?mc_cid=c9d0ba9c8f&mc_eid=UNIQID) .

As a nonprofit organization, our programs are offered free of charge to millions of readers each month. We rely on the support of readers like you to make this work possible.

Make your gift within the next two days, and you‚Äôll have the opportunity to claim our donor-exclusive Ada Lim√≥n blank notebook (https://poets.org/donate/p/28/national-poetry-month?mc_cid=c9d0ba9c8f&mc_eid=UNIQID) , featuring lines from one of her poems. It‚Äôs the perfect size to slip into a coat pocket or tote bag, and only available to National Poetry Month supporters.

Truly, your contribution of any amount (https://poets.org/donate/p/28/national-poetry-month?mc_cid=c9d0ba9c8f&mc_eid=UNIQID) will go a long way towards meeting the financial demands of producing the Academy‚Äôs programs and publications, which include our one-of-a-kind Poem-a-Day series, award-winning lesson plans for teachers, and one of the web‚Äôs most highly-trafficked sites for poetry‚ÄîPoets.org.

Thank you for making our programs possible (https://poets.org/donate/p/28/national-poetry-month?mc_cid=c9d0ba9c8f&mc_eid=UNIQID) , and for your readership.

Gratefully,
https://poets.org/donate/p/28/national-poetry-month?mc_cid=c9d0ba9c8f&mc_eid=UNIQID
Tess O‚ÄôDwyer
Chair | Board of Directors
Academy of American Poets

============================================================

[https://nl.nytimes.com/f/newsletter/nkAS5Cf9hTPT_yf00h0vIg~~/AAAAAQA~/RgRmLiYlP0S_aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cubnl0aW1lcy5jb20vYnkvZGF2aWQtbGVvbmhhcmR0P2NhbXBhaWduX2lkPTkmZW1jPWVkaXRfbm5fMjAyMzA0MjgmaW5zdGFuY2VfaWQ9OTEyNjEmbmw9dGhlLW1vcm5pbmcmcmVnaV9pZD05ODEwOTE2OCZzZWdtZW50X2lkPTEzMTU3MyZ0ZT0xJnVzZXJfaWQ9YmEyZmY2OWVkNmU5ZmVjNmYzMWYzMjJjZTUzNGJkMTVXA255dEIKZD4loUtk31J_oFIfZWVsYWFmemFoaWRAY29sbGVnZS5oYXJ2YXJkLmVkdVgEAAAAAA~~]

Good morning. Long school closures have put public education ‚Äî and Randi
Weingarten, the leader of a major teachers‚Äô union ‚Äî on the defensive.



[https://static01.nyt.com/images/2023/04/30/magazine/28themorning-lede/28themorning-lede-jumbo.jpg]Randi
Weingarten, president of the American Federation of Teachers.Pat Nabong/Chicago
Sun-Times, via Associated Press


THE LONG SHADOW OF SCHOOL CLOSURES

During the early months of the Covid pandemic, Randi Weingarten and the
teachers‚Äô union she leads faced a vexing question: When should schools reopen?

For years, advocates of public education like Weingarten had argued that schools
played an irreplaceable role. School was where children learned academic and
social skills. It was where low-income children received subsidized meals.
Without public schools, their defenders argued, society would come apart.

On the other side of the ledger, however, was the worst pandemic in a century.
Teachers and parents feared that reopening schools before vaccines were
available would spark Covid outbreaks, illness and death.

In 2020, the pandemic‚Äôs first full year, Weingarten came down strongly on the
side of keeping schools closed. Safety measures were not enough to reopen them,
she argued. Instead, Covid became an opportunity for her union, the American
Federation of Teachers, to push for broader¬†policy changes that it had long
favored. As my colleague Jonathan Mahler writes in a new story in the Times
Magazine
[https://nl.nytimes.com/f/newsletter/ZMy6UDZHF8RhGW6BLPS_jg~~/AAAAAQA~_oFIfZWVsYWFmemFoaWRAY29sbGVnZS5oYXJ2YXJkLmVkdVgEAAAAAA~~]:

The A.F.T. had issued its own reopening plan in late April calling for adequate
personal protective equipment, new cleaning and sanitization regimens in school
buildings, a temporary suspension of formal teacher performance evaluations, a
limit on student testing, a cancellation of student-loan debt and a $750 billion
federal aid package to help schools prepare to reopen safely and facilitate ‚Äò‚Äòa
real recovery for all our communities.‚Äô‚Äô

In retrospect, the strategy seems to have failed.

Today‚Äôs newsletter, like Jonathan‚Äôs story, looks at the lingering costs to
public education.


A LOST YEAR

Many other education leaders took a different approach in 2020¬†and came to favor
a faster reopening of schools. In Europe, many were open
[https://nl.nytimes.com/f/newsletter/YmR5Obecu_dghoAQBl4e8Q~~/AAAAAQA~/RgRmLiYlP0TlaHR0cHM6Ly93d3cubnl0aW1lcy5jb20vMjAyMC8wNC8xNy93b3JsZC9ldXJvcGUvZGVubWFyay1zY2hvb2xzLWNvcm9uYXZpcnVzLmh0bWw_Y2FtcGFpZ25faWQ9OSZlbWM9ZWRpdF9ubl8yMDIzMDQyOCZpbnN0YW5jZV9pZD05MTI2MSZubD10aGUtbW9ybmluZyZyZWdpX2lkPTk4MTA5MTY4JnNlZ21lbnRfaWQ9MTMxNTczJnRlPTEmdXNlcl9pZD1iYTJmZjY5ZWQ2ZTlmZWM2ZjMxZjMyMmNlNTM0YmQxNVcDbnl0QgpkPiWhS2TfUn-gUh9lZWxhYWZ6YWhpZEBjb2xsZWdlLmhhcnZhcmQuZWR1WAQAAAAA]
by the middle of the year. In the U.S., private schools, including Catholic
schools
[https://nl.nytimes.com/f/a/wI3uDlqn--5-rvK3DvzpjA~~/AAAAAQA~-JaFLZN9Sf6BSH2VlbGFhZnphaGlkQGNvbGxlZ2UuaGFydmFyZC5lZHVYBAAAAAA~],
which often have modest resources, reopened. In conservative parts of the U.S.,
public schools also reopened, at¬†times in consultation with local teachers‚Äô
unions.

Some people did contract Covid at these schools, but the overall¬†effect on the
virus‚Äôs spread was close to zero. U.S. communities with closed schools had
similar levels of Covid as communities with open schools, be they in the U.S. or
Europe. How could that be? By the middle of 2020, there were many other ways for
Covid to spread ‚Äî in supermarkets, bars, restaurants and workplaces, as well as
homes where out-of-school children gathered with friends.

Despite the emerging data that schools were not superspreaders, many U.S.
districts remained closed well into 2021, even after vaccines were available.
About half of American children lost at least a year of full-time school,
according to Michael Hartney of Boston College.

And children suffered¬†as a result.

They lost ground
[https://nl.nytimes.com/f/newsletter/_a5w1rr0v9G-p5r4VIhhCw~~/AAAAAQA~_oFIfZWVsYWFmemFoaWRAY29sbGVnZS5oYXJ2YXJkLmVkdVgEAAAAAA~~]
in reading, math and other subjects. The effects were worst on low-income, Black
and Latino children. Depression increased, and the American Academy of
Pediatrics declared a national emergency in children‚Äôs mental health
[https://nl.nytimes.com/f/newsletter/frLZmDW4vKIwedPMd7EcDg~~/AAAAAQA~-JaFLZN9Sf6BSH2VlbGFhZnphaGlkQGNvbGxlZ2UuaGFydmFyZC5lZHVYBAAAAAA~].
Shamik Dasgupta, a philosopher at the University of California, Berkeley, who
became an advocate for reopening schools, called the closures ‚Äúa moral
catastrophe.‚Äù

The closures also caused some Americans to sour on public schools. Nationwide
enrollment fell by 1.3 million, or 3 percent, according to the latest federal
data. The share of U.S. adults with little or no trust in public schools rose by
a few percentage points, to 33 percent, according to Gallup. In last year‚Äôs
elections, political candidates who supported vouchers ‚Äî which effectively
reduce public-school funding ‚Äî fared well, as¬†Jonathan explains in his story.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs pretty undeniable that the last few years have been bad for public schools
‚Äî even very bad,‚Äù he told me.


A DEMOCRATIC FAILURE

I recommend his story
[https://nl.nytimes.com/f/newsletter/ZMy6UDZHF8RhGW6BLPS_jg~~/AAAAAQA~_oFIfZWVsYWFmemFoaWRAY29sbGVnZS5oYXJ2YXJkLmVkdVgEAAAAAA~~]
because it‚Äôs a nuanced look at Weingarten and the challenges she now¬†faces.
Republican officials have spent years trying to demonize teachers‚Äô unions, and
Weingarten in particular (including during a House hearing this week
[https://nl.nytimes.com/f/a/l55t5TFjgSIFcbBRt6hARA~~/AAAAAQA~/RgRmLiYlP4QRAWh0dHBzOi8vZWRzb3VyY2Uub3JnL3VwZGF0ZXMvdGVhY2hlcnMtdW5pb24tcHJlc2lkZW50LXJhbmRpLXdlaW5nYXJ0ZW4tdGVzdGlmaWVzLWJlZm9yZS1jb25ncmVzcy1vbi1jb3ZpZC0xOS1zY2hvb2wtY2xvc3VyZXM_Y2FtcGFpZ25faWQ9OSZlbWM9ZWRpdF9ubl8yMDIzMDQyOCZpbnN0YW5jZV9pZD05MTI2MSZubD10aGUtbW9ybmluZyZyZWdpX2lkPTk4MTA5MTY4JnNlZ21lbnRfaWQ9MTMxNTczJnRlPTEmdXNlcl9pZD1iYTJmZjY5ZWQ2ZTlmZWM2ZjMxZjMyMmNlNTM0YmQxNVcDbnl0QgpkPiWhS2TfUn-gUh9lZWxhYWZ6YWhpZEBjb2xsZWdlLmhhcnZhcmQuZWR1WAQAAAAA]),
and have been less successful than they hoped. In Michigan, where Weingarten
campaigned for Democrats last year, as she frequently does, the party won a
sweep of major offices. In Chicago (an overwhelmingly Democratic city), a former
teachers‚Äô union organizer, Brandon Johnson, was elected mayor this month.

These results reflect the fact that many Americans are sympathetic to teachers
and grateful to their children‚Äôs own teachers. Teachers do vital work and don‚Äôt
make big salaries. Many spend their own money on teaching materials when schools
don‚Äôt do so.

In the case of Covid, the risks associated with reopening schools were unclear
in the spring of 2020, and teachers were understandably frightened. Over the
course of the summer, however, evidence increasingly suggested that schools
could reopen without accelerating the spread of Covid ‚Äî and that the costs of
keeping them closed were steep. Despite this evidence, many¬†schools remained
closed for months on end, even after vaccines became available.

Dasgupta, the Berkeley philosopher, has a thoughtful way of framing this
failure. As he wrote to me in an email:

It is clear that extended school closures were a mistake ‚Äî they harmed children
while having no measurable effect on the pandemic. It is also clear that
teachers‚Äô unions were a major factor behind the closures. But remember that the
unions were just doing their job. Their remit is to advocate for their members
and that is exactly what they did.

Seen like this, the problem was not the teachers‚Äô union per se ‚Äî I am personally
in favor of public sector unions ‚Äî but the absence of a comparable organization
at the bargaining table to represent the interests of students and their
caregivers. It was a failure of democratic decision-making.

Looking ahead, my colleague Jonathan puts it this way:

The question (and political debate) is where do we go from here ‚Äî double down on
public education, try to address the learning loss and emotional damage caused
by the pandemic closures and make an effort to restore the nation‚Äôs confidence
in public schools, or create more alternatives via school choice?

As Jonathan notes, public education is likely to be a major issue again¬†in the
2024 campaigns. Read his story about Weingarten here
[https://nl.nytimes.com/f/newsletter/ZMy6UDZHF8RhGW6BLPS_jg~~/AAAAAQA~_oFIfZWVsYWFmemFoaWRAY29sbGVnZS5oYXJ2YXJkLmVkdVgEAAAAAA~~].

SHINY JEWELS WITH A DARK PAST

Christie‚Äôs is preparing for a major jewelry sale next month, and the collection
‚Äî 700 jewels from the heiress Heidi Horten‚Äôs estate ‚Äî is expected to bring in
more than $150 million. (For comparison, Elizabeth Taylor‚Äôs jewels sold for $137
million in 2011.)

But a painful history hangs over the auction
[https://nl.nytimes.com/f/newsletter/T9D8SD_ykA-2zzkP72uYcw~~/AAAAAQA~-JaFLZN9Sf6BSH2VlbGFhZnphaGlkQGNvbGxlZ2UuaGFydmFyZC5lZHVYBAAAAAA~]:
Horten‚Äôs husband, Helmut, built his empire by buying companies from Jews who had
been forced to sell them by the Nazis, often at a steep loss. After drawing
criticism for the sale, Christie‚Äôs added a mention of the history to the auction
listing and said it would donate some proceeds to Holocaust research and
education.

-2119946731.subject: "Ledge" by Kevin Young
-2119946731.text:
No use telling¬†/ the dead what¬†/ you‚Äôve learned since¬†

https://www.facebook.com/POETSorg/?mc_cid=168771921b&mc_eid=UNIQID

https://twitter.com/POETSorg?mc_cid=168771921b&mc_eid=UNIQID

https://www.instagram.com/poetsorg/?mc_cid=168771921b&mc_eid=UNIQID


Poem-a-Day is reader-supported. In honor of National Poetry Month, please consider making a gift to help cover the costs of this important series.
https://poets.org/donate/hfp/national-poetry-month?mc_cid=168771921b&mc_eid=UNIQID
https://poets.org/poem-a-day?mc_cid=168771921b&mc_eid=UNIQID
April 28, 2023


**
------------------------------------------------------------


** Ledge (http://poets.org/poem/ledge?mc_cid=168771921b&mc_eid=UNIQID)
------------------------------------------------------------
Kevin Young (https://poets.org/poet/kevin-young?mc_cid=168771921b&mc_eid=UNIQID)

No use telling
the dead what
you‚Äôve learned since

they‚Äôve learnt it too‚Äî

how to go on
without you, the mercy
of morning, or moving,

the light that persists
even if.

‚ú∂

Beauty is as beauty
does, my mother says,
who is beautiful & speaks

loud so she can be understood
unlike poets who can‚Äôt
talk to save their lives

so they write.

‚ú∂

It‚Äôs like a language,
loss‚Äî
can be

learned only
by living‚Äîthere‚Äî

‚ú∂

What anchors us
to this thirst
& earth, its threats

& thinnesses‚Äî
its ways of waning
& making the most of‚Äî

of worse & much
worse‚Äîif not
this light lifting

up over the ridge

Copyright ¬© 2023 by Kevin Young. Originally published in Poem-a-Day on April 28, 2023, by the Academy of American Poets.
https://traffic.megaphone.fm/POETS3074136107.mp3?updated=1682456237&mc_cid=168771921b&mc_eid=UNIQID


** Subscribe to the Poem-a-Day Podcast
------------------------------------------------------------
https://podcasts.apple.com/podcast/id1497937744?mc_cid=168771921b&mc_eid=UNIQID https://open.spotify.com/show/7rEVm3YLMej7WWvhaIAJya?mc_cid=168771921b&mc_eid=UNIQID https://podcasts.google.com/?feed=aHR0cHM6Ly9mZWVkcy5tZWdhcGhvbmUuZm0vcG9lbS1hLWRheQ%3D%3D&mc_cid=168771921b&mc_eid=UNIQID

‚Äú‚ÄòLedge‚Äô is taken from a longer poetic sequence inspired by Dante [Alighieri] (https://poets.org/poet/dante-alighieri?mc_cid=168771921b&mc_eid=UNIQID) . My friend and fellow poet Robin Coste Lewis (https://poets.org/poet/robin-coste-lewis?mc_cid=168771921b&mc_eid=UNIQID) and I divided up ‚ÄòThe Inferno‚Äô and wrote our respective versions after I was asked by the Museum of Modern Art to respond to Robert Rauschenberg‚Äôs drawings based on ‚ÄòThe Inferno,‚Äô which a friend had read to the artist canto (https://poets.org/glossary/canto?mc_cid=168771921b&mc_eid=UNIQID) by canto, circle by circle. I happened to have grown up with the same John Ciardi (https://poets.org/poet/john-ciardi?mc_cid=168771921b&mc_eid=UNIQID) translation that Rauschenberg heard and, in composing my cantos, incorporated the Dante I first encountered as a teenager, together with African American cosmologies and spirituals that grounded me. Without telling a soul, after the initial project I continued to write through the rest of The Divine Comedy. As its title suggests, ‚ÄòLedge‚Äô is from the ‚ÄòPurgatory‚Äô section, which, in our current era of social and
bodily strife‚Äînot unlike Dante‚Äôs own time‚Äîmanages to offer some hard-won hope.‚Äù
‚ÄîKevin Young
https://poets.org/poet/kevin-young?mc_cid=168771921b&mc_eid=UNIQID

Kevin Young (https://poets.org/poet/kevin-young?mc_cid=168771921b&mc_eid=UNIQID) is the author of Stones (Knopf, 2021) and the children‚Äôs book Emile and the Field (Knopf, 2022), among other titles. He is a Chancellor of the Academy of American Poets and currently serves as poetry editor of The New Yorker.

https://poets.org/poet/kevin-young?mc_cid=168771921b&mc_eid=UNIQID

https://bookshop.org/a/262/9781524732561?mc_cid=168771921b&mc_eid=UNIQID

Stones (https://bookshop.org/a/262/9781524732561?mc_cid=168771921b&mc_eid=UNIQID)
(Knopf, 2021)
https://bookshop.org/a/262/9781524732561?mc_cid=168771921b&mc_eid=UNIQID


‚ÄúAt Night‚Äù by Stanley Plumly
read more (https://poets.org/poem/night-5?mc_cid=168771921b&mc_eid=UNIQID)
‚ÄúIncantation‚Äù by Chris Abani
read more (https://poets.org/poem/incantation-0?mc_cid=168771921b&mc_eid=UNIQID)
http://pcm23.eventbrite.com?mc_cid=168771921b&mc_eid=UNIQID
https://poets.org/poem-day-guest-editors-2023?mc_cid=168771921b&mc_eid=UNIQID
Thanks to U.S. poet laureate Ada Lim√≥n (https://poets.org/poet/ada-limon?mc_cid=168771921b&mc_eid=UNIQID) , author of The Hurting Kind (https://bookshop.org/a/262/9781639550494?mc_cid=168771921b&mc_eid=UNIQID)  (Milkweed Editions, 2022), who curated Poem-a-Day for this month‚Äôs weekdays. As of this year, the U.S. poet laureate guest editorship during National Poetry Month (https://poets.org/library-congress-and-poem-day?mc_cid=168771921b&mc_eid=UNIQID) is a collaboration between the Academy and the Library of Congress. Read or listen to a Q&A (https://poets.org/April-2023-poem-a-day-editor-ada-limon?mc_cid=168771921b&mc_eid=UNIQID)  about Lim√≥n‚Äôs curatorial approach and find out more about our guest editors for the year (https://poets.org/poem-day-guest-editors-2023?mc_cid=168771921b&mc_eid=UNIQID) .


http://poets.org/donate/pad?mc_cid=168771921b&mc_eid=UNIQID
‚ÄúPoem-a-Day is brilliant because it makes space in the everyday racket for something as meaningful as a poem.‚Äù ‚ÄîTracy K. Smith

If this series is meaningful to you, join the community of Poem-a-Day supporters by making a gift today (https://poets.org/donate/hfp/national-poetry-month?mc_cid=168771921b&mc_eid=UNIQID)  in honor of National Poetry Month. Now serving more than 320,000 daily subscribers, this publication is only possible thanks to the contributions of readers like you.

-1552551395.subject: [HUES] Elections TODAY from 1-4 pm
-1552551395.text:
Hey engineers!

CORRECTION: Elections will be held today from *1-4.* Updated candidacy
statements for 2023-2024 HUES Board positions are attached below!

*The election will take place TODAY on Friday**, April 28th *from 1:00PM -
4:00PM EDT*, but will likely not take the entire allocated time.* We will
be meeting in *Sever Hall, room 102. * Everyone is invited to join us!
Please take part in choosing the individuals who will be representing our
engineers in this board next year.


Because the meeting is relatively long, voters can come and go, but *if
you're running for a position please try to stay the whole time. **If you
are running for a position, but are unable to attend
the election deliberations, please email **mollybosworth@college.harvard.edu
<mollybosworth@college.harvard.edu>** as soon as possible.*


*Please email Molly (mollybosworth@college.harvard.edu
<mollybosworth@college.harvard.edu>) with any questions!*

A reminder about voting/election procedures is below.

*Voting/Election:*


   - *The election is open to all members of the hues-open list who would
   like to come for deliberations and voting.*
   - Because the meeting is relatively long, voters can come and go, but *if
   you're running for a position please try to stay the whole time (please let
   us know if you can only stay part of the time.)*
   -  Please keep speeches to under 3 minutes.
   - You may not take part in the deliberations for any position you are
   running for; you will be in a different room while deliberations happen
   among voters.
   - For each position, the candidate with the most votes will be elected -
   for positions with 2 chairs, the candidates with the top 2 most votes will
   be elected.

Please let Molly <mollybosworth@college.harvard.edu> know if you have any
questions, and we hope to see lots of you at 1:00!
--
Maycee Wieczorek
Harvard College Class of 2024
S.B Candidate in Mechanical Engineering

-448137326.subject: [hcs-d] Fwd: [AAA-open] GET PAID TO PARTICIPATE IN STUDY ON AI ASSISTANCE
-448137326.text:
We invite you to participate in a research study conducted by a team of
undergraduate/graduate researchers at MIT Media Lab.

The purpose of this study is to investigate the impact of our system on
critical thinking. Our system passively listens to a conversation between a
user and an interviewer where the user is invited to complete a series of
critical thinking assessments. The user is able to utilize AI assistance in
completing these tasks by prompting an AI assistant with eye gaze, which
then displays the assistance in real time augmented reality. The goal of
this system is passive, real-time integration of human and artificial
intelligence.

During the study (~70min), you will complete a series of questions,
utilizing one of the world‚Äôs most advanced commercial AR headsets (HoloLens
2), that costs $3500. Study Dates: 4/28-4/30.

You will then participate in a post-study survey. Study participants will
receive a $20 worth gift card after the research. Please sign up here
<https://forms.gle/t2wfVE2Abj4AGEui8> to participate!

If you have any questions, contact:

Alina Yu, alinayu@college.harvard.edu

Anhphu Nguyen, anguyen1@college.harvard.edu
[image: image.png] [image: image.png]
